text: today I'm making one of my favorite
one-pot meals it's chicken and rice and
I'm pretty sure that you guys are gonna
love it just as much as I do
anything that can be made all in one pot
is good by me right so what I'm doing
right now is browning my chicken this is
three pounds of chicken I'm using a
combination of drumsticks and thighs
this is a large skillet with straight
sides it's just large enough to hold the
chicken you don't want anything too big
because your liquid will evaporate too
quickly but get your chicken nice and
brown while you're waiting for that you
can cut up an onion the chicken is going
to cook in liquid with the rice which is
going to soften the skin but if you
brown it before you do that you get some
really fantastic flavor and that's what
I'm going for here with the browning of
the chicken always build flavor and then
just add all your ingredients and go
here we have some great variations on
this recipe on Martha Stewart comm we
did them in our April issue you should
check those out if you like one-pot
meals and who doesn't need the
equivalent of one medium onions usually
about one and a half cups of onion
minced this looks good
when your chicken is brown you can take
it out of the pan and set it aside so
you can saute your vegetables that's
what I'm gonna do right now the thighs
get really nice and golden brown because
they're flat the legs aren't as flat so
they don't Brown quite as well but you
still want that browning once your
chicken is removed if you have much more
than a tablespoon or two of fat pour it
off but I'm looking fine here so I'm
gonna leave it all in and add my onion
to the pan a couple tablespoons of
minced garlic and six takeo peppers that
I've sliced these come in a jar their
roasted red peppers or if you can't get
piquillo peppers you can roast them
yourself you want to saute this until
the onions are translucent and while
you're waiting for that to happen you
can soak some saffron in white wine and
just need a pinch of saffron it's very
strong there
a flavorful you can't get it or you're
like it's too expensive I don't want to
you can leave it out but it adds a
really unique flavor to the dish so I
suggest you can get it use it I mean
you'll see I really use the very
smallest amount and it's gonna add a
perfume that is undeniably fantastic so
let that sit there while you're sauteing
your onions 1/2 a cup of white wine dry
white wine once your onions are
translucent you can add a little bit of
tomato paste about a tablespoon I like
to use these tubes because they're
totally resealable and you don't have to
worry about storing the leftover tomato
paste which can get like black and gross
if you have those cans you put them in
the fridge so the tubes are fantastic
for that especially if the recipes that
you're doing don't call for a ton of
tomato paste stir that around for about
30 seconds and then add one and a half
cups of short grain rice you can use
arborio which is the classic risotto
rice you can use bomba which is a rice
that's used in Spanish dishes like
paella
that's a really fantastic rice and if
you can get it I recommend using that
not as common as arborio though so
please feel free to try this with
arborio stir the rice and as you can see
I just added a little bit more fat to
the pan and it felt like it was getting
kind of dry in there you want to coat
each piece of rice with a little bit of
fat and that helps bring out the flavor
as well as as it cooks keep the rice
grains individual now add your wine
mixture and let it completely
for not looking for alcohol in here you
just want that delicious flavor of the
saffron and the wine together so let it
cook completely off doesn't take very
long at all it usually takes about 30
seconds and then add 3 cups of chicken
broth then the chicken goes back in put
it in skin side up what you want to do
at this point is bring the liquid back
to a full boil if that means boiling
even in the very center and have your
oven preheating to 375 degrees I'm just
going to take a couple minutes to do
that and then this goes straight into
your oven 375 for about 25 minutes or
until all the liquid is absorbed oh wait
broth bay leaves don't forget those you

be careful and then you can add your

just put them on top and cover it back
up until they steam through and get warm
it shouldn't take too long up to 10
